tuv.seg: Children starting school can attend national schools, which are State-aided and do not charge fees, or they can attend one of a small number of private primary schools, which do not get any State funding and which charge fees. The vast majority of children attend the state-aided primary or national schools

Is féidir le páistí atá ag tosú scoile freastail ar bhunscoileanna atá ag fáil deontaisí Stáit agus nach mbaineann amach táillí, nó is féidir leo freastal ar cheann d'uimhir bheag bunscoileanna príobháideacha nach bhfaigheann aon airgead Stáit ach a bhaineann amach táillí
The rules about school attendance apply from age 6
Bíonn na rialacha tinrimh scoile i bhfeidhm ó aois a 6
In practice, nearly all 5-year-olds are at school and about half of 4-year-olds in Ireland also attend school
De ghnáth, bíonn beagnach gach páiste chúig bhliana d'aois ag freastal ar scoil agus bíonn timpeall leath na páistí cheithre bliana d'aois, ag freastal ar scoil freisin
Children may not be enrolled at primary school before the age of 4
Ní féidir páiste a chlár i mbunscoil faoi aois a 4
There are various early education or pre-school facilities available but they are mostly private and fees have to be paid
Tá roinnt áiseanna luathoideachais agus réamhscoilear fáil ach tá siad príobháideach den chuid is mó agus tá táillí le n-íoc orthu
There are some State-funded pre-school facilities, which are usually for children who are disadvantaged or have special needs
Maoiníonn an Stát bliain amháin réamhscolaíochta saor in aisce, áfach, tríd an Sceím Cúraim agus Oideachais Luath-Óige (COLÓ)
The State also funds one year of free pre-schooling under the Early Childhood Care and Education (ECCE) Scheme
Tá roinnt áiseanna réamhscoile atá ag fáil deontas Stáit do pháistí faoi mhíbhuntáiste den chuid is mó nó dóibh siúd go bhfuil riachtanais speisiálta acu
There is a system of regulation of pre-schools under the Child Care Act 1991
Tá córas rialacháin ann d'áiseanna réamhscoile faoin Acht Cúram Leanaí 1991
The national school system was established in 1831
Bunaíodh córas na scoile náisiúnta i 1831
The national schools were originally meant to be mixed-religion (or multi-denominational as we would describe them today)
Bhí na scoileanna náisiúnta ceaptha a bheith ag freastal ar pháistí reiligiún measctha ar dtús nó ilchreidmheach mar a déarfaimis inniu
In practice, that did not happen and the majority of national schools are under the management of one church
Ní mar sin a thárla agus in dáiríre tá formhór na scoileanna náisiúnta faoi bhainistíocht eaglaise amháin
However, since the 1970s Educate Together has established many multi-denominational national schools
Tá scoileanna ilchreidmheacha á riaradh ag Educate Together, áfach
When the national schools were originally set up, there was no legislation governing how they were to be run
Nuair a bunaíodh na scoileanna náisiúnta ar dtús, ní raibh aon achtú ann ag rialú an chaoi a stiúrfaí iad
Circulars and rules issued from the relevant department instead
Tháinig rialacha agus imlitreacha ón Roinn in ionad sin
The Rules for National Schools reflect the fact that they are largely denominational schools
Taispeánann Rialacha do Scoileanna Náisiúnta gur scoileanna ilchreidmheach iad den chuid is mó
The Education Act 1998 does not use the term 'national school' and instead uses 'primary' school
Ní úsáideann an tAcht Oideachais 1998 an téarma 'scoil náisiúnta' ach 'bunscoil'
The name is not particularly significant except that 'national school' clearly indicates that the school is State-aided while a primary school can be private or State-aided
Ní dhéanann an t-ainm mórán difríochta ach go dtuigtear go bhfuil deontas Stáit ann do scoil náisiúnta agus gur féidir le bunscoil a bheith príobháideach nó deontas Stáit a bheith aici
The following initials are frequently used to describe schools:
Úsáidtear na cinnlitreacha seo leanas go minic le cur síos orthu
NS - National School
NS (SN) - Scoil Náisiúnta
GNS - Girls' National School
GNS (SNC) – Scoil Náisiúnta Cailíní
BNS - Boys' National School
BNS (SNB) – Scoil Náisiúnta Buachaillí
SN - Scoil Naisiúnta (appears before the name rather than after it)
SN – Scoil Náisiúnta (roimh an ainm)
Some schools use the Irish form of their name but that does not necessarily mean that they teach through the medium of Irish
Úsáideann roinnt scoileanna an leagan Ghaeilge dá nainm ach ní chiallaíonn sé sin go múintear tré mheán na Gaeilge iontu
Gaelscoileanna are schools that teach through Irish and they usually, but not invariably, include the word 'Gaelscoil' in their title
Is scoileanna náisiúnta iad Gaelscoileanna a mhúineann tré Ghaeilge, agus de ghnáth ach ní i gcónaí, bíonn Gaelscoil ina dteideal
Multi-denominational schools sometimes include that description in their title
Úsáideann scoileanna ilchreidmheachaan téarma sin uaireanta ina dteideal féin
Some primary schools are run by religious orders - they are sometimes called convent or monastery schools
Bíonn roinnt bunscoileanna stiúrtha ag oird eaglasta – glaotar scoileanna clochair nó mainistreach orthu uaireanta
They operate under the same rules as other primary schools except for some special rules relating to the appointment of principals and the choice of teacher representatives on the board of management
Oibríonn siad faoi na rialacha céanna le scoileanna náisiúnta eile, ach go bhfuil roinnt rialacha speisialta maidir le ainmiúchán na bpríomhoidí agus an rogha múinteoirí ar an mBord Bainistíochta
The Department of Education and Skills lists schools geographically under Find a School
Tá Liosta de Bunscoileanna foilsithe ag an Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna

There are several special schools - including residential care units and schools for children with disabilities, young offenders, children at risk, children with specific learning disabilities and emotionally disturbed children

Tá roinnt scoileanna speisiálta ann – ag tógáil san áireamh aonaid cúram cónaitheach agus scoileanna do pháistí le míchumas, ógchiontóirí, páistí i mbaol, páistí le míchumas foghlamtha áirithe agus páistí le suaitheadh sochorraitheach
The ownership of primary schools is quite complex
Tá úinéireacht na mbunscoileanna casta go leor
In general, they are privately owned and State-funded
Go ginearálta tá siad in úinéireacht phríobháideach agus iad maoinithe ag an Stát
While the school ethos is decided by the owners, the operating rules are largely set by the State
Cé go ndéanann na húinéirí socrú ar mheoin na scoile, bíonn na rialacha stiúrtha leagtha síos ag an Stát den chuid is mó
A Forum on Patronage and Pluralism in the Primary Sector was set up in 2011 to consider how primary school patronage structures might be adapted to reflect changes in society
Cuireadh Fóram faoi Phátrúnacht agus Iolrachas san Earnáil Bhunscoile ar bun i 2011 chun a mheas conas na struchtúir phátrúnachta bunscoile a athchóiriú chun aird a thabhairt ar athruithe sa tsochaí
Its report was published on 10 April 2012
Foilsíodh a thuarascáil an 10 Aibreán 2012
Private primary schools receive no State support, nor are they subject to State control in relation to curriculum, school day, school year, etc
Ní fhaigheann bunscoileanna phríobháideacha aon chabhair Stáit agus níl siad faoi cheannas Stáit maidir leis an gcúrsa léinn, an lá scoile, scoilbhliain & rl
There is a limited element of State assessment of private schools because the State is required to ensure that children receive a certain minimum education
Tá roinnt bheag measúnú stáit ar scoileanna phríobháideacha mar gheall go bhfuil orthu déanamh cinnte de go bhfaigheann páistí méid áirithe oideachais
Teachers in private primary schools are not paid by the State and there are no requirements about their qualifications
Ní íocann an Stát múinteoirí i mbunscoileanna phríobháideacha agus níl aon choinníollacha maidir lena gcáilíochtaí
Many private primary schools do provide the basic curriculum as set out for national schools but they are not obliged to do so
Cuireann go leor bunscoileanna príobháideacha an cúrsa léinn bunúsach mar atá leagtha síos do scoileanna náisiúnta ar fáil ach ní gá dóibh seo a dhéanamh
Parents have a constitutional right to choose the kind of school to which they want to send their children and have a right to educate them at home if they wish
Tá ceart bunreachtúil ag tuismitheoirí an cineál scoile atá siad ag iarraidh dá bpáistí a roghnú agus tá ceart acu oideachas a chur ar na páistí sa mbaile má's mian leo
There is no absolute requirement on schools to admit any particular student
Níl gá do scoileanna aon chineál scoláire a chlárú
Schools are required to publish their admissions policy
Tá iachall ar scoileanna a bpolasaí cláraithe a fhoilsiú
Schools are subject to equal status legislation and to the constitutional requirements on religion
Tá scoileanna faoin Reachtú stadais Comhionannais agus na coinníollacha bunreachtúla maidir le reiligiún
All primary schools are obliged to publish a school plan that describes their ethos, admissions policy and objectives
Ní mór do gach bunscoil plean scoile a fhoilsiú ina bhfuil cur síos ar éiteas, beartas i leith iontrálacha agus cuspóirí na scoile
The admissions policy of most primary schools is fairly straightforward - they give priority to children from their local area, which, for denominational schools, is usually the local parish

Bíonn beartas formhór na mbunscoileanna i leith iontrálacha soiléir go leor - tugann siad tús áite do leanaí óna limistéir féin, agus i gcás scoileanna sanchreideamhacha is é an paróiste áitiúil an limistéar sin
Admissions problems can arise in expanding areas where the school cannot cope with extra numbers
Is féidir fadhbanna maidir le hiontrálacha a bheith i limistéir atá ag fás nuair nach féidir leis an scoil déileáil le líon breise páistí nua
Where there is an accommodation problem, the school must give priority on the basis of their admissions policy, sometimes called an enrolment policy
Má bhíonn fadhb cóiríochta ann ní mór don scoil tosaíocht a thabhairt do leanaí ar bhunús a beartas i leith iontrálacha. Uaireanta tugtar beartas rollaithe air seo
This is drawn up by the board of management and should be available to you on request
Is é an bord bainistíochta a dhréachtann é agus ba chóir go bhféadfá é a fháil ach é a iarraidh
Schools run by the minority religions usually give priority to their co-religionists
De ghnáth tugann scoileanna atá á reáchtáil ag creidimh mhionlaigh tús áite do leanaí a bhfuil an creideamh céanna acu
The admissions policy for multi-denominational and non-denominational schools and Gaelscoileanna is decided by each school
I gcás scoileanna ilchreideamhacha, scoileanna neamh-shainchreidmheacha agus Gaelscoileanna is í an scoil féin a cheapann a beartas i leith iontrálacha
The admissions policy must comply with section 7 of the Equal Status Act 2000
Caithfidh an beartas i leith iontrálacha géilleadh d’Alt 7 den Acht um Stádas Comhionann 2000
If a school refuses to enrol your child you may appeal the decision to the school’s board of management
Má dhiúltaíonn scoil do leanbhsa a chur ar an rolla féadfaidh tú achomharc a dhéanamh chuig an mbord bainistíochta faoin gcinneadh
If this does not succeed you may appeal the decision to the Department of Education and Skills
Má theipeann air seo féadfaidh tú achomharc a dhéanamh chuig an Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna
More information about this is in the Circular 22/02 Appeals Procedures under Section 29 of the Education Act 1998 and in the Department's section document on appeals procedures
Is féidir tuilleadh eolais a fháil faoi seo i gCiorclán 22/02 Nósanna Imeachta faoi Alt 29 den Acht Oideachais 1998 agus sa doiciméad faoi nósanna imeachta achomharc a d’eisigh an Roinn
When choosing a primary school, parents may also need to know about the admissions policies of secondary schools
D’fhéadfadh sé tarlú go mbeadh gá do thuismitheoirí fios a bheith acu agus iad ag roghnú bunscoile faoi bheartais na meánscoileanna i leith iontrálacha
Some secondary schools give priority to the students from certain primary schools
Tá roinnt meánscoileanna ann a thugann tús áite do dhaltaí ó bhunscoileanna áirithe
